channel.title: Lombardy on Blanka's Travel Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Lombardy on Blanka's Travel Blog

item.title: Milano
item.description: Milano. If you tell anyone that you are in Milano, the general reaction is “ooo, how lucky you are what a beautiful city!

item.title: Como and Ticino
item.description: Chiasso The town has a really simple function: the border town between Lombardy and the Ticino canton.

item.title: Pavia
item.description: I finally found the Maastricht of Italy. The cute university town with a gezellig atmosphere, cute stoned streets, glorious history and fulfilling liveliness.

item.title: Mantova, Cremona
item.description: Renaissance, isolation and high life quality. What more do you need.

item.title: Garda - The South
item.description: If you look at the Garda lake on the map,it’s pear shape is really apparent with the wide round south narrowing itself continuously into the mountain valley.

item.title: Brescia
item.description: A week after our visit I learned from my classmate who is from Bergamo, that they hate Brescia.

item.title: Bergamo
item.description: Brescia and Bergamo have basically the same structure: the lower modern city and the upper historical part.

item.title: Garda - The West
item.description: It seemed like a good idea to book a weekend holidays at Lombardy til its such a good weather.

item.title: The Milano agglomeration
item.description: The unimaginable happened. We left our lovely Piemonte and crossed the magical line this ending up in Lombardy.
